resources.string: Lets take a look at Dublin!
This classic pub houses 2 fine old snugs (small rooms for women in days of old) and an Irish menu.
Lunch at Hargadon\'s is always buzzing. Dinner is more elaborate but still in the casual dining category and with good value thrown in.

Music and song native to our peninsula. The words and notes of our music passed from generation to generation, father to daughter, mother to son, and in our pub, we offer visitors a glimpse at our rich heritage.
Murphy\'s Pub with its traditional open fire provides a warm contemporary setting with the character of an Irish bar full of old world charm.
Great relaxed atmosphere in the heart of Temple Bar., great food, friendly staff . brilliant music.
Old-time bar with Irish bartenders, 2 kinds of ale (light or dark) & sawdust on the floor.
Modern pub with extensive cocktail menu using botanical infusions, also serving artisan coffees.
Traditional decor and menu, with an extensive range of sushi, plus European desserts and sake.
American-style comfort such as chicken wings and burgers with breakfast and brunch menus.
Colourful restaurant and bar with modern decor and a menu of classic Mexican and Italian dishes.
Dining in SOLE is about the full customer experience, from the moment you are greeted, eating the best seafood in Dublin, or enjoying a drink from our extensive bar and wine menu.
Carved wooden tables, golden statues and fabric draped rooms give opulent feel to Indonesian menu.
Pachino\'s aim is to provide a delicious and mouthwatering menu accessible to all.
Upmarket restaurant with original features and a menu of refined Irish and European dishes.
Saint Annes Park is a 240 acres public park situated between Raheny and Clontarf, suburbs on the northside of Dublin, Ireland. It is owned and managed by Dublin City Council

St Stephen\'s Green is a city centre public park in Dublin, Ireland. The current landscape of the park was designed by William Sheppard. It was officially re-opened to the public on Tuesday, 27 July 1880 by Lord Ardilaun.

Beautiful park at the outskirts of Dublin. Really clean and well maintained with plenty of flowers during summer time. Little hilly and super picturesque with cabintealy house in the middle. Amazing playground for kids at all ages and really nice brambles cafe for parents.

Phoenix Park is an urban park in Dublin, Ireland, lying 2–4 km west of the city centre, north of the River Liffey. Its 11 km perimeter wall encloses 707 hectares; it is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.
The Blanchardstown Centre is one of Ireland\'s largest shopping centres, located in Blanchardstown, Dublin, Ireland. It opened in October 1996 and was extended in 2004 to create extra retail space.
The Ilac Centre is a shopping centre, located in central Dublin, north of the River Liffey. It has entrances opening onto Henry Street, Parnell Street and Moore Street.

The Jervis Shopping Centre is a major shopping centre in Dublin, Ireland. Opened in 1996, the centre is located in the area bordered by Jervis Street, Upper Abbey Street, Mary Street, and Liffey Street. The centre has a total of 70 stores including clothing, food and electrical outlets.
Stephen\'s Green Shopping Centre is a large indoor shopping centre located at the top of Grafton Street in the Southside of Dublin City. It is named after St. Stephen\'s Green, a nearby park.
